unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Plant Manager | 2 of 2
question_text: A plant manager wants to see if there are different proportions of defective items among the four machines at her automotive plant. She randomly selects $100$ automobile parts from each of the four machines, as shown in the table below: Machine A B C D Number of Defective Parts 58 61 51 54 Suppose a fifth machine, E, was added and had $57$ defective parts out of $100$ randomly tested. This added data will:

choices.text: Not necessarily change the p p -value.
Change the p p -value somehow, but it is not obvious how exactly.
